name: ThreatStream
description: Integrates a variety of generic, reputation and investigative actions from the Anomali ThreatStream threat intelligence platform

organization_id.description: Organization ID for filtering incidents when polling
organization_id.verbose: Organization ID is mandatory while polling and is used for filtering the incidents to ingest.

first_run_containers.description: Maximum number of incidents to poll in the first run of the scheduled polling

ingest_only_published_incidents.description: Ingest only incidents marked as published

is_cloud_instance.description: Is the provided instance in hostname parameter cloud?

actions.description: Test connectivity to ThreatStream by querying the intelligence endpoint
Get information about a file
actions.verbose: If nothing is found, this is because ThreatStream has no information on that file. If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.

limit.description: Total number of observables to return

actions.description: Get information about a given domain
actions.verbose: If nothing is found, this may be due to the format of the domain. Try excluding any subdomains (namely www). If there is still no information found, then it is because ThreatStream has no information on that domain. ThreatStream, however, may still have Passive DNS (PDNS) information on it, which can be found in extra data. If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.

limit.description: Total number of observables to return

actions.description: Get information about a given IP
actions.verbose: If nothing is found, then it is because ThreatStream has no information on that IP. ThreatStream, however, may still have Passive DNS (PDNS) information on it, which can be found in extra data. If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.

limit.description: Total number of observables to return

actions.description: Get information about a given email
actions.verbose: If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.

limit.description: Total number of observables to return

actions.description: Get information about a URL
actions.verbose: If nothing is found, this is because ThreatStream has no information on that URL. If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.

limit.description: Total number of observables to return

actions.description: Execute a whois lookup on the given IP
actions.verbose: ThreatStream returns whois info as a raw string (present in the raw field) which the app will then attempt to parse into the output. Depending on the contents of the raw string, it may not be able to parse all or any of the required fields.

Abuse of the Whois system through data mining is mitigated by detecting and limiting bulk query access from single sources. Where applicable, the presence of a [Non-Public Data] tag indicates that such data is not made publicly available due to applicable data privacy laws or requirements. Should you wish to contact the registrant, please refer to the Whois records available through the registrar URL listed above. Access to non-public data may be provided, upon request, where it can be reasonably confirmed that the requester holds a specific legitimate interest and a proper legal basis for accessing the withheld data. actions.description: Get observable present in ThreatStream by ID number

actions.description: List observables present in ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
• The observables will be listed in the latest first order on the basis of created_ts.
  • If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.

limit.description: Total number of observables to return

• The vulnerabilities will be listed in the latest first order on the basis of created_ts.
  • If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.

limit.description: Total number of vulnerabilities to return

actions.verbose:
• The incidents will be listed in the latest first order on the basis of created_ts.

actions.description: Import observables into ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
• For importing observables of type 'URL', 'IP' and 'Domain', user must provide indicator type in the field parameter (e.g - {"itype": "<indicator_type>"}). Threatstream itself detects the confidence value for these observable types
  • For importing observables of type 'Email', 'File', user must provide indicator type and confidence value in the field parameter (e.g - {"itype": "<indicator_type>", "confidence": <confidence_value>}).

fields.description: JSON formatted string of fields to include with the observable

create_on_cloud.description: Create on remote (cloud)? (applicable only for hybrid on-prem instances)

example_values: Successfully sent the request for importing the observable

source_user_id.description: ID of user to associate with tag

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to associate with this Observable

tlp.description: TLP to assign to each tag
tlp.verbose: A TLP of red will make the tag private for the user's organization.

example_values: PNG image data, 400 x 220, 8-bit gray+alpha, non-interlaced

actions.description: Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality

container_count.description: Maximum number of container records (incidents) to query for

actions.description: Run observables query in ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
For providing the query parameter, please form a valid search string using the Anomali filter language (as seen on the advanced search page). If the saved_search parameter is filled out, it will take priority over the query parameter. Note the saved_search parameter is the ID of the saved search in Anomali. You can get the ID by going to the Analyze then Observable tab, and under the search bar click the manage button. The search If searching by the JSON format you will need to convert the Anaomli query to JSON as an example: Anomali filter language-based search string = modifed_ts__gt=2018-01-10&status=active has to be provided in the query parameter as { "modifed_ts__gt": "2018-01-10", "status": "active" }
If offset is provided in the 'query' parameter, it will be overwritten by the offset value provided in the 'offset' parameter.

query.description: Search string to use to filter the results from Anomali. Use the query_type parameter to control the type of data you are doing to use.

query_type.description: The type of the query we want to run. AFL is for the raw Anomali Filter Language query as seen on the advance search page. e.g (type="ip") and (status="active") JSON is the JSON reprentation of the Anomali filter language

saved_search.description: Search by the saved search ID in Threatstream

order_by.description: Field by which the query results will be ordered

offset.description: Record offset (used with paging, when returning many results)

example_values: imported by user 13487 Confirmed as false positive
